page.title: 15Sewage Works-Dorking NE
page.content: The sewage works are in Box Hill Valley,so the sewage drains down from high level places and is pumped up from lower level places. The works treat on average four-five thousand cubic meters of sewage a day, from a population of 25,0000.20% of sewage comes from a large abbatoir and the the rest from domestic use. The fumes from the works are often smelt in the local area on hot humid days. At the screening house and pumping station,rags and wood are removed.Then the{detritus}(sand and grit)is removed in a circular settling tank.Next,the sewage is broken down by{microbes, } leaving only gasses and water.The microbes are removed in a final settling tank,and the clean water flows into the{River Mole. The sludge is sent to local farms.
